intro: Berteroa graeca, commonly known as the Greek fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its feathery, aromatic leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters and thrives in well-drained soils. Its seeds are often used in culinary applications, similar to those of fennel. Botanically, it is notable for its structure and adaptability to arid environments.
